name: Loews Philadelphia Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful two-night stay at the Loews. The building is fabulous, the spa and restaurant excellent, and the room was beautiful. We had a huge corner suite with incredible views. There were some glitches at check-in, but the staff more than made up for it--we look forward to staying there again.
reviews.title: Stylish; great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: In town on business. Hotel was recommended and arranged by the group we were visiting. This was absolutely the most comfortable hotel room I have enjoyed. I would move in in a minute. The luxurious linens, thick carpet, huge windows, thick terry robes, bathroom heating, bellman, all were excellent. The interesting historic detail of the building and the respect paid in the renovation made it even more enjoyable.
reviews.title: WOW, What an elegant experience

likes.disliked: — lack of in building parking at certain hours

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Young couple, age 30 stayed at this hotel in August 2006. The building is quite impressive, loved the look and the lobby. Watchout - parking is valet only and over $35 a day. The room was spacious, but just dated and dingy. Definitely not what I expected based on the website, the "look and feel" of the rest of the building, and the Loews name. The dominating color was light pink and the carpet was stained and old. Dated furniture and art. The bathroom was much better, large with black marble and deco feel. Except the shower curtain had a huge stain on it - Gross! The staff was attentive and nice. Location was great too, near Reading Station and Electric Factory (the purpose of our visit). I booked the hotel based on its proximity to the Electric Factory (about a mile and a half). Next time we go, we are looking elsewhere to get a bit more bang for our buck.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Having stayed in most of the nicer hotels in Center City, I was anxious to finally have a night at the beautiful art deco Loews. The building, location, and common areas are fabulous, but I was very unimpressed with the room. I had a room on a the 24th floor with 2 doubles. The first thing anyone will notice in such a room is the view, which is absolutely stunning through the wall of windows. However, I found these windows to be quite drafty as there was a chilly wind blowing in Philly that day. The room had a rather cold and institutional feel to it with bland peach walls and very little to decorate them. The high ceilings are nice in some ways, but with nothing to "bring them down" they create an un-cozy atmosphere. The bed was comfortable, but uninspiring, especially in this era of every hotel's "signature" bed with top-end linens and down all around. The bathroom felt old, and other than the countertop, seemed in need of a facelift. The curtain was a challenge to close as it easily got caught on the track. But worst of all, the hotel was loud. There was very little to dampen sound echoing from the hall, and the slamming doors woke me throughout the night. I was also surprised at the amount of "city noise" from such a high floor. With hotels like the Ritz and Sofitel nearby, I would not recommend staying at the Loews.
reviews.title: Great views; everything else just OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I LOVE this hotel -- stayed here Christmas day one year when our kids went to the X's and we were sad -- what a way to cheer up! Our floor to ceiling windows looked right down on the statue of William Penn atop the grand City Hall building -- gorgeous bathroom, wonderful service, huge original Cartier deco clocks as you walk out of elevators on each floor, beautiful carpets. This was one of the first skyscrapers ever built in this country and even the carpets and floor tiles are elegant. Have a great time & ask for a high, corner room for the best views! Fitness club is great, too!
reviews.title: Superb art deco building/ Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed at Loews because it was a unique modernist building and close to the convention center. The decor was very hip, very cool, with an Art Moderne approach to everything from the carpet to the furnishings. The interior design was a trip, a lot of fun. On location, the hotel is walking distance to most places you want to see in downtown Philadelphia. The staff there was friendly and helpful--always a plus.
reviews.title: Very hip, very cool design

likes.disliked: — ground floor restaurant was too trendy for me

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I are visiting in Philly celebrating our anniversary where we were married 25 years ago.
reviews.title: Shortsheeted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our bed in our over 300$ a night hotel was shortsheeted!. No sheet, no mattress pad, nothing on half the mattress. I called the front desk and a lovely and very pregnant woman came up and tried to redo the bed but had obviously no experience with bedmaking. She left off the cover sheets so the blanket was the only cover. The woman explained she was a night manager and had never made a bed. The housekeeping crew was gone. It was 11 PM.
reviews.title: Overall...decent short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I remade the bed.
reviews.title: Not worth the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I explained the problem to the day manager the next day he simply said he would report it to housekeeping and looked bored. Not even an apology!
reviews.title: Good City Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby and lounge/bar area of this hotel are a great place to relax, just beware. You can relax with a cocktail (watch out, my glass of wine was $11!) and watch the people go by in comfort. There is no free wireless internet, which is very much a disappointment. I purchased a day pass for $10.95, hoping I could use it in the room later on, but the wireless signal didn't reach up to my room on the 29th floor. So an hour into my visit to the Loews I spent $22 for a glass of wine and an hour of internet...not very good way to start off.
reviews.title: Just ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I got up to my floor, there were bath towels all over the floor, I don't know if it was because it was snowing out or what, but the carpets were covered in bath towels, very strange. The room itself was just ok. Bathroom is huge, they should have designed the room so that some of the area of the bathroom was used in the sleeping area. The bed itself was alright, the linens seemed really small, my husband and I struggled for "posession" of the covers all night.
reviews.title: Rocky start but all turned out well...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The TV is a nice flat screen with HD capability, but no HD channels, the channel selection was also very limited.
reviews.title: Loved the Lowes Hotel - Great location

likes.liked: — The beauty of the building, mixing the old with the new
likes.disliked: — Check out the breakfast on the 5th floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, since I couldn't use the wireless day pass I purchases earlier, I was bound to the desk with the ethernet cord. The layout of the room was such that I couldn't work on the computer and see the TV at the same time, very awkward layout.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The biggest plus of this hotel is its location, right in the middle of it all.
reviews.title: Cool Building, OK Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did the Philly Overnight Hotel package for the King Tut exhibit at the Franklin Institute. We had such an enjoyable time and what made the experience even better was our stay at the Loews. Let me first say that the staff at the Lowes was super nice and helpful. They understand the term “great customer services”. The hotel it self is beautiful with the marbles floors. Our room was even more beautiful with the flat screen TV and nice comfortable king size bed. Not to mention our view of Philadelphia was stunning. The hotel sits in the middle of downtown so you are near everything….restaurants, stores, theaters, lounges, etc…So close that you can choose to walk or take a cab. Worth every penny.
reviews.title: Worth every penny.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Loew's Philly is a really fun and funky larger hotel with a surprisingly personable staff.
reviews.title: Great Vibe and Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Location: Midtown near the convention center, right on Market, a couple blocks from the Reading Terminal Market and a short walk to Rittenhouse, Old City, etc.
reviews.title: One of my favorite hotels

likes.liked: — The clean room, the friendly staff, the location to the convention center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Amenities: Bar, restaurant, fitness center, internet, all the usual big city, large hotel amenities.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice Touches: The staff are super personable and helpful. We went on New Year's Eve weekend and it was very festive. They had out cookies, cider, etc., in the lobby as if the hotel was an inn.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel for the price!

likes.disliked: — The first room smelled like smoke

description: Experience some of our "Newly" renovated guest rooms at the Loews Philadelphia Hotel. The first skyscraper ever built in the City of Brotherly Love is home to Loews Philadelphia Hotel. Contemporary décor and gracious hospitality make Loews Philadelphia one of Center City's most inviting luxury hotels, recognized as of the “World’s Best” by Travel + Leisure readersThe supremely comfortable 581 guest rooms include 12 suites and 54 concierge club rooms, all of which are luxuriously appointed and are furnished to suit the needs of both families and business travelers.Create a memorable culinary experience in an upscale, hip environment at SoleFood Restaurant and Lounge, where eclectic cool mixes with classic style. Relax in the 15,000 square foot spa and enjoy a wide variety of treatments, full service hair salon, complete cardio center and twenty-meter, two-lane heated lap pool.Loews Philadelphia Hotel features 42,000 square feet of versatile conference space. Groups up to 1,500 can be accommodated in the variety of unique spaces ranging from 500 to nearly 10,000 square feet.Located in the heart of the city with the famous PSFS sign still illuminating the Philadelphia skyline, Loews Philadelphia Hotel is perfectly situated so you can take advantage of everything this city has to offer.
